awd_abstract_narration:
The conference “Frontiers in Stochastic Analysis” will be held at the University of Illinois at Chicago, in Chicago from Aug 09 to Aug 11, 2023.  It covers a variety of topics in stochastic analysis. These topics are deeply related to each other and reflect current trend of research in the field. The plenary speakers have been chosen by a scientific committee, not only for their outstanding research records but also for their excellent lecturing style. Their talks will provide an overview of several frontiers of current research in the field. In addition, the conference features a program of short talks. This program provides young researchers, senior graduate students and post-docs in particular, with an opportunity to showcase their research. 

Probability theory is the mathematical theory concerned with the analysis of random phenomena. Many of such phenomena may mathematically be modeled by continuous stochastic processes or random fields.  Stochastic analysis is an active branch of probability theory that provides a wide range of tools to study those processes and fields. The choice of research topics of the conference reflects several aspects of stochastic analysis areas that have become the object of intense study in recent years. The broad array of topics covered will broaden the scope and interest of graduate students and early career researchers. The conference also provides an easily accessible platform for interaction among different generations of researchers in the field and for communication among different areas of stochastic analysis. The conference website is: http://frontierstochastic.weebly.com/

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The 2023 Frontiers in Stochastic Analysis Conference (2023-FISA) was held Wednesday, August 9 to Friday, August 11, 2023 on the campus of University of Illinois at Chicago, Chicago, IL. The conference was organized by Cheng Ouyang (University of Illinois at Chicago) and Jing Wang (Purdue University).  The scientific committee members included Sandra Cerrai (University of Maryland), Masha Gordina (University of Connecticut), Davar Khoshnevisan (University of Utah) and Samy Tindel (Purdue University).

The conference consists tutorial lectures, featured talks, invited talks and contributing sessions. There were five invited featured speakers who gave the following talks:

Fabrice Baudoin (University of Connecticut): Generalized stochastic areas, Winding numbers, and hyperbolic Stiefel fibration.

Yu Gu (University of Maryland): Effective diffusivities in periodic KPZ.

Tai Melcher (University of Virginia): Functional inequalities for degenerate diffusions and some applications.

Andrea Nahmod (University of Massachusetts Amherst): Invariant Gibbs measures for 2D NLS and 3D cubic NLW.

Hao Shen (University of Wisconsin): Two tutorial lectures on Introduction to stochastic quantization.

The grant supported the participation of graduate students, postdocs, early career mathematicians, and individuals from groups that are under-represented in probability. The conference also hosted a casual gathering for Women in Probability participants to encourage peer support, networking, and mentorship, which contributed to the retention of women mathematicians in stochastic analysis.

During 2023-FISA, over 86% of the 75 registered conference participants were students, postdocs or early career mathematicians. This diverse mix of attendees facilitated a dynamic exchange of ideas, leading to new professional connections and research collaborations.

 


Last Modified: 09/04/2024
Modified by: Jing Wang
